bt.title: Battery Recycling Guidelines
steps: Remove batteries from devices if possible
Keep different types of batteries separate
Tape the terminals of lithium batteries
Store in a cool, dry place
Take to a certified battery recycling center
bt.tips: Never dispose of batteries in regular trash. They contain hazardous materials that can harm the environment.

ge.title: General Electronics Recycling Guidelines
steps: Back up and wipe all personal data
ge.tips: Electronics contain valuable materials but also hazardous substances. Always recycle through proper channels.

me.title: Metal Recycling Guidelines
me.tips: Most metals are 100% recyclable. Clean metal items thoroughly to avoid contamination.

ow.title: Organic Waste Guidelines
steps: Avoid meat and dairy in home composting
ow.tips: Organic waste can be composted to create nutrient-rich soil. Avoid composting meat, dairy, and oily foods.

pe.title: PET (Polyethylene Terephthalate) Recycling Guidelines
pe.tips: PET is highly recyclable. Clean containers thoroughly to avoid contamination.

pp.title: Polypropylene Recycling Guidelines
pp.tips: PP is widely recyclable. Make sure containers are clean and dry before recycling.

sn.title: Steel/Nickel Recycling Guidelines
sn.tips: Steel and nickel are highly recyclable. Clean items thoroughly to maintain quality.

aerosol cans.title: Aerosol Can Recycling Guidelines
aerosol cans.tips: Aerosol cans are pressurized and should be handled carefully. Never puncture or crush them.

aluminum food cans.title: Aluminum Food Can Recycling Guidelines
aluminum food cans.tips: Aluminum is 100% recyclable. Clean cans thoroughly to avoid contamination.

aluminum soda cans.title: Aluminum Soda Can Recycling Guidelines
aluminum soda cans.tips: Aluminum cans are highly recyclable. Clean thoroughly before recycling.

battery.title: Battery Recycling Guidelines
battery.tips: Batteries contain hazardous materials. Never dispose in regular trash.

cardboard boxes.title: Cardboard Box Recycling Guidelines
cardboard boxes.tips: Cardboard is highly recyclable. Keep it clean and dry.

cardboard packaging.title: Cardboard Packaging Recycling Guidelines
cardboard packaging.tips: Clean cardboard packaging is fully recyclable. Remove all non-cardboard elements.

clothing.title: Clothing Recycling Guidelines
clothing.tips: Consider donating wearable clothing. Damaged items can be recycled into new products.

coffee grounds.title: Coffee Grounds Recycling Guidelines
coffee grounds.tips: Coffee grounds are great for composting and gardening. They add nitrogen to soil.

disposable plastic cutlery.title: Plastic Cutlery Recycling Guidelines
disposable plastic cutlery.tips: Consider switching to reusable cutlery. Many facilities don't accept plastic cutlery.

eggshells.title: Eggshell Recycling Guidelines
eggshells.tips: Eggshells are rich in calcium. Great for composting and gardening.

food waste.title: Food Waste Recycling Guidelines
food waste.tips: Food waste can be composted. Avoid composting meat, dairy, and oily foods.

gauze.title: Medical Waste Guidelines
steps: Do not mix with regular trash
gauze.tips: Medical waste requires special handling. Contact local healthcare facilities for disposal.

glass beverage bottles.title: Glass Bottle Recycling Guidelines
glass beverage bottles.tips: Glass is 100% recyclable. Clean bottles thoroughly before recycling.

glass cosmetic containers.title: Glass Cosmetic Container Recycling Guidelines
glass cosmetic containers.tips: Clean glass containers thoroughly. Remove all product and non-glass elements.

glass food jars.title: Glass Jar Recycling Guidelines
glass food jars.tips: Glass jars are fully recyclable. Clean thoroughly to avoid contamination.

gloves.title: Glove Recycling Guidelines
gloves.tips: Consider reusable alternatives. Some gloves can be recycled into new products.

keyboard.title: Keyboard Recycling Guidelines
keyboard.tips: Keyboards contain valuable materials. Consider donating if still functional.

magazines.title: Magazine Recycling Guidelines
magazines.tips: Magazines are recyclable. Remove all non-paper elements before recycling.

mask.title: Face Mask Recycling Guidelines
mask.tips: Consider using reusable masks. Some facilities accept disposable masks for recycling.

microwave.title: Microwave Recycling Guidelines
microwave.tips: Microwaves contain valuable materials. Consider donating if still functional.

mobile.title: Mobile Phone Recycling Guidelines
mobile.tips: Many retailers offer trade-in programs. Consider donating if still functional.

mouse.title: Computer Mouse Recycling Guidelines
mouse.tips: Consider donating if still functional. Otherwise, recycle through e-waste program.

newspaper.title: Newspaper Recycling Guidelines
newspaper.tips: Newspapers are highly recyclable. Keep them clean and dry.

office paper.title: Office Paper Recycling Guidelines
office paper.tips: Office paper is highly recyclable. Remove all non-paper elements.

paper cups.title: Paper Cup Recycling Guidelines
paper cups.tips: Many paper cups have plastic lining. Check local recycling rules.

pcb.title: PCB (Printed Circuit Board) Recycling Guidelines
pcb.tips: PCBs contain valuable materials but also hazardous substances. Requires special handling.

plastic cup lids.title: Plastic Cup Lid Recycling Guidelines
plastic cup lids.tips: Check local recycling rules. Some facilities don't accept small plastic items.

plastic detergent bottles.title: Plastic Detergent Bottle Recycling Guidelines
plastic detergent bottles.tips: Clean containers thoroughly. Most detergent bottles are recyclable.

plastic food containers.title: Plastic Food Container Recycling Guidelines
plastic food containers.tips: Clean containers thoroughly to avoid contamination. Check local recycling rules.

plastic shopping bags.title: Plastic Shopping Bag Recycling Guidelines
plastic shopping bags.tips: Many grocery stores have bag recycling bins. Consider using reusable bags.

plastic soda bottles.title: Plastic Soda Bottle Recycling Guidelines
plastic soda bottles.tips: Most soda bottles are PET and highly recyclable. Clean thoroughly.

plastic straws.title: Plastic Straw Recycling Guidelines
plastic straws.tips: Consider using reusable straws. Many facilities don't accept plastic straws.

plastic trash bags.title: Plastic Trash Bag Recycling Guidelines
plastic trash bags.tips: Consider using biodegradable bags. Many facilities don't accept plastic bags.

plastic water bottles.title: Plastic Water Bottle Recycling Guidelines
plastic water bottles.tips: Most water bottles are PET and highly recyclable. Clean thoroughly.

player.title: Media Player Recycling Guidelines
player.tips: Consider donating if still functional. Otherwise, recycle through e-waste program.

printer.title: Printer Recycling Guidelines
printer.tips: Many retailers offer printer recycling programs. Consider donating if still functional.

shoes.title: Shoe Recycling Guidelines
shoes.tips: Many brands offer shoe recycling programs. Consider donating if still wearable.

steel food cans.title: Steel Food Can Recycling Guidelines
steel food cans.tips: Steel cans are 100% recyclable. Clean thoroughly to avoid contamination.

styrofoam cups.title: Styrofoam Cup Recycling Guidelines
styrofoam cups.tips: Many facilities don't accept styrofoam. Consider using reusable cups.

styrofoam food containers.title: Styrofoam Food Container Recycling Guidelines
styrofoam food containers.tips: Many facilities don't accept styrofoam. Consider using reusable containers.

syringe.title: Medical Waste Guidelines
syringe.tips: Medical waste requires special handling. Never dispose in regular trash.

tea bags.title: Tea Bag Recycling Guidelines
tea bags.tips: Some tea bags contain plastic. Check if your brand is fully compostable.

television.title: Television Recycling Guidelines
television.tips: Many retailers offer TV recycling programs. Consider donating if still functional.

tweezers.title: Metal Item Recycling Guidelines
tweezers.tips: Metal items are highly recyclable. Clean thoroughly before recycling.

washing machine.title: Washing Machine Recycling Guidelines
washing machine.tips: Many retailers offer appliance recycling programs. Consider donating if still functional.
